name: Braised Lentils With Garlic Sausage
keywords: fall, winter, gluten-free, lentils, sausage, main course
recipeIngredient: 2 garlic cloves, peeled; 1 finely chopped, 1 halved
2 pounds fully cooked pork sausage such as French garlic sausage (see note), sliced 1 1/4-inch thick
5 sprigs fresh thyme, tied with kitchen string
1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, plus additional

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil over medium heat in large, heavy-bottomed saucepan or Dutch oven. Slice onion into quarters; cut quarters crosswise into 1-inch chunks. Add onion, celery and garlic to pan; cook, stirring, until onions are translucent, about 10 minutes. Do not let vegetables brown (lower heat if necessary).
Add sausage, lentils, thyme and enough water to cover. Season with salt and pepper. Simmer, partially covered, until lentils are tender, about 1 hour.
Season with vinegar and additional salt and pepper. Discard thyme. Stir in the parsley. Serve warm, with mustard alongside.
